content:
I'm happy to help! Getting back on track with a healthy diet can be challenging, but having healthy snack options can make a big difference. Here are some easy-to-prepare and nutritious snack ideas to help you get started:

**Fresh Fruits**

1. Fresh fruit skewers with grapes, strawberries, and pineapple
2. Apple slices with almond butter or peanut butter
3. Banana bites with honey

**Veggie Delights**

1. Carrot sticks with hummus
2. Cucumber slices with dill dip
3. Cherry tomatoes with balsamic vinegar and mozzarella cheese

**Protein-Packed**

1. Hard-boiled eggs
2. Greek yogurt with berries and honey
3. Edamame

**Nuts and Seeds**

1. Trail mix with nuts, seeds, and dried fruits
2. Roasted chickpeas seasoned with herbs and spices
3. Energy balls made with oats, nuts, and dried fruits

**Whole Grain Crackers**

1. Whole grain crackers with avocado spread and cherry tomatoes
2. Whole grain crackers with almond butter and banana slices
3. Whole grain crackers with hummus and cucumber slices

**Other Options**

1. Smoothies made with frozen fruits, yogurt, and milk
2. Energy-boosting energy bars (look for natural ingredients and minimal added sugar)
3. Cottage cheese with fruit or cucumber slices

**Tips**

1. Prepare your snacks in advance to save time and ensure healthy choices.
2. Choose snacks that are high in fiber, protein, and healthy fats to keep you full and satisfied.
3. Avoid sugary drinks and processed snacks that can drain your energy.
4. Experiment with different combinations of snacks to find what works best for you.

Remember, small changes can add up over time. Start with one or two healthy snack options and gradually incorporate more as you get back on track with your diet. Good luck!
